content.description:
I dont normally like traverses but this one is fun and interesting. 

  Start as per "Showbread" but follow the ascending, funky, juggy, arête/roof lip with inventive moves. 

  Top out as per "Inner Shrine".

To the far left of the roof, find the very low, hard to find, large undercling and the shaky, loose, but solid green sandstone jug to start. Move up to big jugs and climb out of the short steepness to gain more jugs. Follow to the easy top.

Stand start at the base of the roof mid-wall in-between the top of the Alter Boulder (which forms tha patio under the roof) and the base of the roof. 

  Start in the undercling/pinch combo and reach into the crack/crimp. Grab the amazing horn jug and work out to the lip of the boulder. Once you get the jugs, wrestle over and make the easy hike to the top.

The Tabernacle (Hebrew: îùëïý, mishkan, "residence" or "dwelling place"), according to the Hebrew Bible, was the dwelling place for the divine presence, Built to specifications revealed by Yahweh. The fullest description of the Tabernacle describes an inner shrine (named Holy of Holies) housing the Ark of the Covenant and an outer chamber (Holy Place) with a table for showbread, and altar of incense. 

  The Tabernacle Roof is a short, 6.5ft, horizontal roof over the "Altar Boulder which provides a close "patio" under the roof. 

  This roof has beautiful quartzite streaks, nice crimp and pinch features, and easy to moderate problems. Tabernacle houses a couple awesome, short, and powerful problems, a cool setting, and "Inner Shrine" is a problem that shouldnt be missed!
